At Yung Kee Restaurant, not just you can try the world famous Signature Roasted Goose, you can also find tasty Catonese food ranging from exquisite home-styled, award-winning, to special dishes. Standing in the heart of Hong Kong's shopping and business district, Yung Kee Restaurant is your first step to taste authentic top quality Cantonese cusinie.

This bijou and romantic Alpine chalet home-from-home is where welcoming and cosy meet affordable, authentic Swiss food and global wines, in an unpretentious and relaxed setting unaltered since 1965. Seek out this enduring hidden gem for a delightful experience to share with friends and family.

Interior space is highlighted by wooden paper screens, natural wood and open sushi bar giving an airy feel. The ‘user friendly’ menu features traditional favourites and innovative creations with anemphasis on fresh sushi and sashimi. A must try are Joe’s Soft Shell Crab Rolls and deliciously fresh Spicy Toro Tartar.

description: The iconic Italian restaurant Isola incorporates an elegant mix of natural colour and modern scenic features representing Hong Kong’s hustle and bustle lifestyle, creating a refreshing and young atmosphere-led dining adventure for guests to immerse and enjoy themselves. The culinary team provides diners with its signature and all-time favourite dishes throughout lunch, afternoon tea, dinners and weekend brunch. Serving both classic and innovative cocktails, and an extensive collection of fine Italian wines, this will be a bustling and breath-taking gastronomic dining spot for guests across all hours.

name: Gaia Ristorante
address: G/F, Grand Millennium Plaza, 181 Queen's Road Central, Sheung Wan
description: Gaia (meaning 'happy' or 'positive' in Italian) is a sophisticated, contemporary Italian restaurant located on the Italian inspired piazza at Grand Millennium Plaza in Central. In addition to an outstanding menu of regional Italian classics, Gaia is well known for its daily antipasto buffet - one of Hong Kong’s finest and freshest selections of favourite Italian starters, savouries, salads and cheeses, and a wine list that boasts over 600 Italian and French wines.

name: Spices
address: G/F, 109 Repulse Bay Road Repulse Bay
description: Spices is popular for its diversified and authentic Asian cuisine, tasteful Eastern design and wonderful garden setting punctuated by spacious green lawns and tropical blooms. The refurbished Spices boasts a new contemporary interior. Inspired use of natural materials, such as bamboo, teak, rattan, stone and coconut, in contrast with bold, vibrant colours gives the restaurant a distinct Asian identity. The lively and inviting space, evocative of a bustling Asian spice market, will undoubtedly enchant and inspire all the senses. Several landscape enhancements have also been made to The Garden - an outdoor section of Spices celebrated for being the finest venue for alfresco wining and dining in Hong Kong. The interior design improvements are complemented by an enriched menu of authentic Asian delights, prepared to perfection by the highly talented culinary team.

name: The Peak Lookout

description: Situated above the city overlooking Pokfulam Country Park and the South China Sea, The Peak Lookout is a Hong Kong landmark with unique character. The restaurant, having served generations of patrons including both locals and visitors, offers fine food within an elegant heritage house seeped in rich history. This Grade II historic building, typifying 'East meets West' architecture, first began offering light refreshments in 1947 and continues to serve a wide range of international dishes of exceptional quality. The Peak Lookout recently reopened its doors following a stylish redesign, which includes the introduction of a contemporary raised terrace, ensuring a relaxed ambience ideal for al fresco dining. The restaurant's stunning location and natural surroundings means it offers guests a different experience each visit, depending on the time of year.

The Gaddi’s Chefs’ Table offers an unforgettable, exclusive experience at the forefront of the culinary action.

Originally opened in 1933, variety, quality and a wealth of culinary styles are the signatures of The Verandah, serving breakfast, lunch and dinner, as well as an array of cakes and sandwiches in the afternoon.

description: Opened Since 1998 In Hong Kong As The Brain-child Of Veteran Restaurateur, Mr. Carmelo Lopez. A Native Spanish Himself, He Came To Asia In The 70's But Was Still Nostalgically Attached To The Richness And Exquisite Taste Of The Cuisine Of His Motherland. Ole Was Created From This Crave For Authenticity! Just Experience The Genuine Touch Of Spain The Moment You Step Inside The Restaurant: The Lemon Yellow Plastered Walls And Glazed Terracotta Tiles Of The Mediterranean, The Lighting Fixture And The Decorative Potteries Directly Flown From Spain. All These Elements Combined To Recreate A Unique And Cozy Atmosphere That Goes Hand In Hand For The Enjoyment One Of The World's Finest Cuisines. The Extensive Variety Of Delicacies, Perfect With The Spanish Wines, Sangria Or Chilled Beers. Live Guitar Music Throughout The Evening Gracefully Exhilarates A Relaxing And Enjoyable Mood.

description: Grissini commands panoramic views of Victoria Harbour and adopts a contemporary interior design, providing a relaxed and casual atmosphere for guests to enjoy authentic Italian cuisine. The signature grissini breadsticks are served during lunch and dinner accompanied by fragrant extra-virgin olive oil and house-blended balsamic glaze. The Grissini kitchen is helmed by Chef de Cuisine Marcello Scognamiglio who grew up in the sunny, coastal city of Naples, influenced by the fishing culture and his grandmother’s home cooking. The new menu offers authentic country cuisine from all corners of Italy, including distinct Mediterranean flavours from the southern Campania region where Chef Marcello is from—fresh seafood, creamy burrata and giant Amalfi lemons. Chef Marcello takes a creative approach to traditional Italian cuisine and believes in the simplicity of premium ingredients, perfectly prepared.

description: Crystal Jade takes pride in its famous Lanzhou-style “La Mian” (hand-pulled noodles), which are made in house the moment customers place their orders. Each bowl of noodles is served in a wholesome, savory soup brewed from chicken, dry-cured ham and pork bone. “Xiao long bao” (soup dumplings in Shanghai style) is another favorite signature dish, being exquisitely made with fresh meat and filled with flavorful juices. In addition to preparing classic home-style dishes like Sautéed Prawn in Chilli Sauce, Beef Slices in Spicy Soup, and Braised Pork with Dried Beancurd Sheet, Crystal Jade also creates unique delicacies such as Sweet & Sour Cucumber Skin Roll, Chilled Black Fungus tossed in Aged Vinegar, and Sweetened Ham served with Crispy Beancurd Sheet and Chinese Bun to leave customers with a truly memorable gastronomic experience.

The restaurant is now relocated to a stunning new harbourview venue within our hotel on the Lower Level, opposite Harbourside. The new Yan Toh Heen, designed by CAP-ATELIER, preserves the restaurant’s rich heritage and elegant jade theme – while showcasing a unique series of spaces inspired by a jade jewellery box which opens to reveal layers of treasured collectables and discoveries of Cantonese culinary arts. Executive Chef Lau Yiu Fai, who has over 30 years of experience with the hotel, having first joined the restaurant when it opened in 1984, invites you on a culinary exploration and celebration of the restaurant’s new era with exquisite new Cantonese dishes that blend tradition with modern flair. description: NOBU, the world's most acclaimed Japanese restaurant, is renowned for its innovative new-style Japanese cuisine by world famous chef Nobu Matsuhisa. NOBU InterContinental Hong Kong, showcases Nobu’s signature dishes, as well as new creations using local ingredients. With panoramic views overlooking Victoria Harbour and Hong Kong Island, NOBU InterContinental Hong Kong features a stunning yet intimate dining room inclusive of a sushi bar. Both the bar lounge and exclusive private dining room have magnificent views of Victoria Harbour and Hong Kong Island. The design of NOBU InterContinental Hong Kong is inspired by Chef Nobu Matsuhisa's innovative cooking and the imagery of the Japanese countryside where he grew up. Traditional and modern Japanese elements, combined with the influence of water inspired by the adjacent Victoria Harbour, culminate in this intimate, yet dynamic dining experience. Open daily for lunch and dinner; serves Afternoon Tea every Saturday & Sunday from 2:30-5pm.

name: Clipper Lounge
address: 5 Connaught Road Central
description: Clipper Lounge is a long-established favourite with Hong Kong locals and hotel guests alike and a wonderful place to meet at any time in the day. Clipper Lounge has a timelessly elegant feel with mink, taupe and mandarin furnishings enhanced with subtle Oriental accents. While popular for breakfast and dinner buffets, as well as our Sunday champagne brunch Hong Kong locals love, Clipper Lounge is best known for afternoon tea. Elegantly presented, the spread includes delicacies such as finger sandwiches, sweets, scones and our signature homemade rose-petal jam. We also offer extremely popular seasonal themed teas.

name: Chilli Fagara
address: 7 Old Bailey Street Central
description: Established in 2005, Chilli Fagara first opened on Graham Street in Soho and soon attracted a loyal clientele with our authentic, fiery Sichuan cuisine. The shop's intimate size, burnished red walls, dark wood furniture and simple details create warmth, while our cuisine creates fire. Based on the Ma La Tang concept for numbing (ma), burning (la) and neutral (tang) tastes of Sichuan food, our menu represents the breathtaking range of culinary possibilities fashioned by our chef each day, all using the freshest ingredients. Many people describe our food as orgasmic. The intensity mounts and grows until you reach the top. Then you have to calm yourself, and we have dishes for that, too. Our Sichuan specialties are for the daring palate. Dramatic and challenging, they offer an unforgettable experience. But there is also plenty on the menu for a relaxing dining experience with entrees that offer delicate flavor combinations. In 2015, we opened our second Soho location on Old Bailey Street in a more spacious venue where patrons can bask in the eclectic mix of contemporary and traditional Chinese décor, while enjoying the same fiery and complex flavors that our entrees are renowned for.

name: The Place

Paper-thin slices of Inner Mongolian black-headed mutton is cooked instantly and stays tender even when boiled for longer periods of time. Served with succulently seasoned sauces made from ancient secret recipes provide a fiesta of flavours. An exclusive selection of seasonal sake is also available, including some rare choices in town. Designed with contemporary clean lines to reflect the simplicity and serenity of Japanese culture, Kaetsu employs wood, stone and clay with soft lighting to create a cosy and sophisticated atmosphere. The large elevated sushi counter in the centre of the restaurant enables guests to view the chefs in action. name: The Chairman
address: No.18 Kau U Fong, Central
description: Cantonese cuisine is light and delicate, and strives to bring out the original flavors of food. The foremost element of good food is the use of the finest and freshest ingredients. To us, local produce is an excellent choice. Chickens and pigs are raised locally in the New Territories. They taste great because they are fed with good quality forage and slaughtered daily. A number of old-style condiment stores continue to adopt traditional ways to produce superb first extract soy sauce in its purest and freshest form, and hand craft beancurd sheets with strong bean taste. A small number of local fishermen are persistently sailing out during the early hours to the South China Sea to catch live fishes and shrimps. In places like Yuen Long, there are a substantial number of vegetable farmers working diligently on their fields. At The Chairman, we have all along tried our best to acquire these freshest among the freshest ingredients, although their prices are slightly higher.

Set in the exclusive J-Senses development, Koh Thai Wanchai raises the bar when it comes to Thai dining in the area. With a huge outdoor terrace and a large open kitchen, guests can watch our professional Thai chefs work their magic, while being looked after by our ever attentive, welcoming staff. Serving stunning Thai food with a wine list to match, this is a True escape in the heart of Wanchai.

name: M Bar - Mandarin Oriental, Hong Kong
address: 5 Connaught Road Central Central
description: With a fabulous location on our 25th floor, M bar is the stylish epicentre of Hong Kong’s nightlife. Enjoying stunning views over the glittering skyline, we have established ourselves as one of the city’s most popular destinations. Enjoying a chic design with a stunning central bar, M bar serves a selection of rare, small batch spirits sourced from around the world, liqueurs handcrafted in-house, re-imagined classic cocktails, and cuisine by Chef Pierre Gagnaire. The bar also serves “East Meets West” cocktails, paying homage to the classics while celebrating an inspired new wave of mixology that incorporates homemade infusions, each adding a twist from the Orient. In addition, M bar has curated its high quality wine and champagne menu to provide something to tantalise the taste buds of every guest. The menu features dishes created by legendary Chef Gagnaire, bringing guests a selection of seasonal delicacies perfectly executed by the two Michelin star team.

name: Captain's Bar - Mandarin Oriental, Hong Kong
address: 5 Connaught Road Central Central
description: Keeping Hong Kong entertained for over 50 years, Captain’s Bar is a city institution. Popular with both guests and locals alike, it has been Hong Kong’s favourite after-work watering hole for decades. Enjoying a relaxed, cosy decor with red, wood and brass furnishings, Captain’s Bar exudes comfortable, classic style. Famous for nightly jazz performances and for serving draught beer in silver tankards—regulars receive their own engraved with their name—it’s the kind of place you stop by for a drink and stay all night. Child policy: Children aged 6-17 years are only permitted in Captain's Bar for food and non-alcoholic drinks before 7pm. Dress code: Before 5pm, comfortable attire is welcomed. After 5pm, we request that guests refrain from wearing shorts (of any length), torn jeans, sportswear, singlets, collarless T-shirts, flip flops and gentlemen's sandals.

The Chinnery is home to one of the world's largest collections of single malt whiskies. We also serve chilled draft beer in silver tankards by a veteran staff who know many guests by name.

address: G/F, 20A D'Aguilar St, Central
description: We are a late night restaurant and bar focused on food mainly from Mexico City. Not the type that you find in every city… the complete opposite in fact. We pride ourselves that our food features healthy options, small bite size items, loads of variety and it all comes together on an eclectic menu. But Brickhouse is more than just amazing food, just as important are the drinks, service and that we are in the dining room meeting and talking with you late in to the night…At Brickhouse we believe it’s the raw fundamentals that makes food exciting in the first place; great ingredients, sensible and simple preparation cooked by people who care. The best ingredients will always be in style. Brickhouse is transporting Mexico City’s diverse cuisine into dishes and drinks with explosive and addictive flavours to surprise your senses. Brickhouse is a simple feel good sanctuary to eat, drink and hang out all night long.Awards: - Best New Restaurant -- Sassy Awards 2013 (Brickhouse)- Best Restaurant for Dinner -- Sassy Awards 2013 (Brickhouse)- Foodie Forks Awards - Readers' Choice, Best New Restaurant (Brickhouse)- Best Restaurant -- Asia Tatler 2013 (Brickhouse)- Best New Restaurant -- Eat & Travel Guide 2013 (Brickhouse)- 4/5 stars -- HKMag July 2012 (Brickhouse)- Highly recommended by Chinese celebrity food critic, Susie Wong (Brickhouse)- 'Best post-party munchies in town...' --- Prestige August 2012 (Brickhouse)- Mexican Consul General's foodie faves -- Baccarat HK September 2012 (Brickhouse)- 'Tacos get elevated to gourmet heights at Brickhouse...' -- Where Magazine October 2012 (Brickhouse) - '...Brickhouse, by this very definition, is the epitome of cool." -- HKMag December 2012 (Brickhouse)

name: Iberico & Co. Kitchen & Bar
address: G/F, 18 Shelley Street SoHo, Central
description: Iberico & Co. Kitchen and Bar, This award winning restaurant by Enoteca Group has been a bustling hit since it opened its doors in early 2013 becoming a permanent popular fixture on the streets of SoHo. Designed by award-winning interior designer Kinney Chan, Iberico & Co offers something completely unique to SoHo customers; an airy, spacious and somewhat grand interior with an unpretentious gastro bar feel. “The interior is exactly what we envisioned” says Robert Cooper, director “a glammed up version of the Estacio de Franca in Barcelona, with its black metal arched ceiling”. Concrete walls, black iron, recycled wood, lead glass and wire mesh combines stunningly with mosaic flooring, Portuguese flower tiles and plush cyan blue and magenta pink fabrics. Robert casually describes it as “gastro-railway chic”. Like all Enoteca Group restaurants, the focus is on good food, designed to share and of course with a Spanish and Portuguese inspired menu.

Designed by celebrated, London-based Ilse Crawford, the interiors are as noteworthy as the art on its walls, entering Duddell's feels like being welcomed into the home of a great art collector - one that also happens to have an in-house Michelin-starred Cantonese restaurant, a lush 2,000 square foot Garden Terrace, and sophisticated salon with artisanal cocktails and vintage champagne.

The inspiration for Kishoku derives from combining Western elements with a traditional Japanese Zenshuyo style to create a warm and relaxing environment. The focus is on the juxtaposition of opposites, using wood and stone elements, complimented by varying geometric shapes. The contrast of stillness and movement can be seen though different graphic elements and featured art installations. Be tantalized by our chef’s artistry at either one of our signature sushi bars, or delight yourself in our seasonal chef’s menu in the privacy of your own partitioned seating or private room.

ChocoDuck also provides food for the soul by introducing works of local born artists, artists living on Cheung Chau and artists inspired by this beautiful island. Private dining, catering for sailing boats, event handling service such as mini concert and art jamming are welcome.

Most dishes are 'tapas sized', which makes sure you can taste several of them in one sitting. This is a concept that's very close to the hearts of the owners: Patrick Verhoeven and his wife Anne Engels. Informal, intimate and affordable, 238 is offering modern French cuisine at prices which suit the current times. All customers love Anne's friendly European hospitalities. Head Chef Patrick Verhoeven aims to give you a very personal experience of the taste of modern French cuisine with other European influences. Using only fresh seasonal and ecological ingredients, the flavours from Europe are combined to create a fusion of tastes and textures.

Mounting a big white bike on its brick wall has become a brand icon for BRICK LANE, coupled with dark wood furniture and vintage bulbs without coverings set an ambient English gastro-pub mood. The design of the Glasshouse takes its inspiration from potting sheds in old country houses; a room filled with wheel barrows, rakes, terracotta pots etc. The material pallet is natural and rustic, consisting mainly of granite, steel and pine, and has been antiqued to give lived in quality. Taiwanese-born chef Jowett Yu’s innovative cooking style reinterprets classic Chinese dishes and flavours with premium ingredients, modern techniques and a touch of humour.

name: Mama San Restaurant & Bar
address: 1/F, No.46 Wyndham Street, Central
description: MAMA SAN by Will Meyrick - With his Scottish heritage, an Australian accent and an Indonesian home, Will Meyrick isn't easily categorized. Often described as Western on the outside and Asian on the inside, Will's passion for the cuisine culture and culinary heritage of this fascinatingly diverse part of the world, is what really defines him and sets him apart as a chef and restaurateur. This award winning chef and restaurateur now brings his incredible talent to Mama San in Hong Kong. Lavishing a collection of Asian flavours on his menu, Will continues to delight diners with an amazing collection of dishes from the South East Asian region. Mama San incorporates an atmosphere of exotic Balinese decor, superb dining and great bar for relaxation. Lunch and dinner daily.

address: 4/F, Lee Garden One, 33 Hysan Avenue, Causeway Bay
description: An Nam features the best of authentic cuisine from all parts of Vietnam with specialization in Hue-style dishes. With French colonial interior designs, antique furniture and paintings. An Nam evokes the atmosphere of the French Indochine for its guests.

name: Fish & Chick
address: Shop 6, G/F, No. 25 New Praya, Kennedy Town
description: Overlooking the Victoria Harbour at Kennedy Town, Fish & Chick serves UK's all-time favourite - beer-battered fish & chips! Not to miss out any details of how the British have their fish & chips, we have mushy peas and malt vinegar! Knowing different people have different preferences, we offer a variety of fishes, which our customers can choose from. To fulfill the local's preference, we have daily fresh Seabass and Barramundi while the foreigners can have their Cod or Haddock and many others. For those who are health-conscious, they may opt for the pan-fried fresh fishes. We all know that some people may not fancy fish & chips because of many other reasons, but fret not, we have French-style rotisserie chicken which we use fresh chicken from the local market and marinate it with our own special marinade before slow-roasting it. The end result will be a flavourful, tender, juicy chicken meat with a crispy skin. Some of the best reasons to come over to our restaurant is the atmosphere, seaview, excellent food, gentle sea breeze and the occasional splashing of waves. Customers coming with their cameras will want to sit at our semi-outdoor bench to take pictures and enjoy one of the best sunset in Hong Kong! We are a friendly and casual restaurant, therefore, you can relax with your glass of wine or your pint of beer while you have your meal. All our food in the menu are made and prepared with passion and love - from our fish & chips, roasted chicken, hand-prepared snacks & salad and home-made desserts, not forgetting, even our tartar sauce is unique because it is made by us, Fish & Chick!

description: B E P is a very simple idea - it means Vietnamese kitchen. Only the freshest ingredients from spices, leafy vegetables to seafood and meat hand-picked daily would be used so the recipe that is being passed on from generations to generations would not lack luster keeping your stomach filled with satisfaction and love. B E P translates the quaint dainty style of Vietnamese street food culture into a modern and creative communal canteen. Atmosphere is welcoming, personal and young. This cosy restaurant becomes home to a contemporary Vietnamese open kitchen where you want to keep coming back for tasty munch and relaxed vibe.

The menu for Plat du Jour, meaning 'dish of the day', was created by long-term Swire Hotels collaborator David Laris who made its ever-changing daily specials the bistro's pre-eminent feature. Laris, who is renowned for his success at Sir Terence Conran's Mezzo and his namesake restaurant Laris at Three on the Bund, also ensured Plat du Jour would make waves with its all-time classics such as steak tartare, boeuf bourguignon, moule marinières and tarte tatin. With burgundy leather banquettes, marble table tops, full length mirrors and a traditional mosaic entrance floor, Plat du Jour's interior, designed by Zangellini & Holt Associates, allows our guests to experience the cosy, much-adored Parisian bistro atmosphere.

description: “Takagi” means tall tree. The name could be traced back to the Edo Era in Japanese history, Takagi is among the six most prominent families resided in Roppongi who all had the word “Ki” a.k.a. tree in their surnames. Takagi Yakitori represents our desire to strive in upholding the Japanese tradition in preparing our food. Takagi Yakitori's consulting team is composed of a number of people who know the Japanese culture inside out, including ex-CRC DJ Cheng Ka Fai. We intend to bring out the best of a Japanese izakaya, from the ingredients used to the taste of the food to the ambience of the place. Takagi Yakitori is very particular about the freshness of our ingredients, they are either imported from Japan or picked from the fresh markets every day.

description: 100% Raw Vegan. Plant-based. Organic. Natural. Eco-friendly. Meat Free. Gluten Free. Dairy Free. Egg Free. Soy Free. Free from Refined Ingredients. Greenwoods Raw Cafe is the 1st raw vegan restaurant in Hong Kong and China. When you enter GreenWoods Cafe, what you are enjoying is more than a meal! - You will enter another world in which setting is simple yet warm and encompassed with a relaxing and green ambiance. - You will be served with all raw, alive, vibrant and moral dishes! (Not heated over 41C to keep the enzymes, no meat, no dairy, no egg, no refined sugar and no guilt; fresh, local, organic (at our best) and high quality ingredients) - You are injected with positive energy from our happy culinary team who make food with care, blessing and love always. - You will be inspired by our creativity and innovation. - You will be satisfied but never sluggish after our meals as we emphasize food combination. Come to try our lunch and nourish body-mind-soul.

name: FRITES Belgium on Tap

description: FRITES has expanded to Causeway Bay on Haven Street, just a five-minute walk from Hysan Place. Lively Belgian beerhouse FRITES brings a taste of Europe to Hong Kong. FRITES offer authenticity from decor, food, service to the delicious selection of traditional Belgian cuisine, along with extensive selection of over 80 types of Belgian Beers.

Presented like a traditional brasserie and best enjoyed family-style, the menu showcases an unexplored genre of Vietnamese cuisine complemented by an approachable and well-curated list of French wines, cocktails and digestifs.

Feast on popular street food from different nooks and corners of India while sipping a signature cocktail or fine wine in a cool, Bindaas setting. Join us for Happy Hours ~ 30% OFF ALL ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES everyday from 5pm to 8pm

description: Gia Trattoria Italiana is where food lovers and wine enthusiasts converge to experience the best of what Italy has to offer in a warm, family style atmosphere. We deliver authentic regional Italian cuisine spanning from the coast to the heart of Italy, and each dish is prepared with the utmost care and seasonal ingredients that are gifted from nature. Our Chef & founder, Gianni Caprioli, is a deeply accomplished and respected Italian Chef in Hong Kong’s culinary scene and the driving force behind our various restaurant concepts’ successes such as Giando Italian Restaurant & Bar on Star Street (previously in Fenwick pier), Fishsteria Seafood Place, Mercato by Giando, Mercato Gourmet, and now, Gia Trattoria Italiana in Fenwick Pier. At Gia Trattoria, we have built a loyal following by adhering simple principles – a burning passion for excellence, commitment to our community and transparency in our kitchen. Share a meal with us and experience our warmth, passion, and True dedication.

The Chef has many years experience in delivering authentic, flavourful and traditional Mexican dishes. PICOSO provides a great atmosphere and offers a new colour to the fast developing restaurant.

name: Beef & Liberty Stanley Burgers
address: Shop G04, G/F, Stanley Plaza, No.23 Carmel Road, Stanley
description: Beef & Liberty is our modern homage to the original beefsteak clubs and, we hope, the tastiest hamburger you will have tried in a while. We are obsessed with hamburgers. We have spent many years trying to create the perfect burger - one that is juicy, beefy, smoky and downright delicious. We think we have succeeded in our quest for perfection we are delighted to share our obsession with you. We proudly serve hormone-free grass-fed beef. Our beef is from Hereford cattle which are naturally raised by small-scale farmers in the Cape Grim region of Tasmania, which has the cleanest air in the world. Why grass fed beef? Cows naturally eat grass, which produces leaner meat, high in Omega-3 fatty acids and vitamin E. We freshly grind the beef in our burgers in-house daily and serve it on a custom-baked white sour-dough roll. Add friends and family, top it off with some great craft beers, house cocktails or a fresh Liberty lemonade and you've got our version of what a perfect hamburger experience should be. Recognized as “the best burger in Hong Kong” by the South China Morning Post and awarded a Bib Gourmand by Michelin. Welcome to Beef & Liberty, we hope you enjoy it.

The bar seating opens you up to a panoramic complete open kitchen view where chefs can showcase their techniques, and satisfy your curiosity with all the work that are usually done behind the scene.

On the 29th floor, we have our VEA Lounge, where we offer high end cocktails, spirits and wines, as well as a more casual approach of food, featuring a terrace where smoking is also available.

address: G/F, California Tower, 30-32 D'Aguilar Street, Lan Kwai Fong, Central
description: Ciao Chow is a casual open-kitchen Italian cafeteria that promotes lively interaction between our patrons and our chefs. A theater of sorts, where your meal is freshly prepared and your drink expertly poured in front of you at our pizza kitchen, chef’s kitchen and cocktail bar. From our communal tables, to our pick-and-choose antipasti platters, pastas and pizzas, everything at Ciao Chow fosters a convivial atmosphere where food is shared among family and friends. With a decidedly Italian touch, Ciao Chow’s interior features monolithic marble counter tops and terrazzo floors blended with an industrial feel of exposed concrete, copper piping and light fixtures. Within our large seating area, our chef’s table can fit up to 10 people to accommodate special requests and occasions. Our customers can be assured that all of the ingredients we use are of the highest quality and our cooking methods authentic. We do not cut costs for cheaper ingredients - period. Who would have thought that basic food ingredients could be so highly complicated? WE DO.

At the bar you can enjoy classic cocktails with a twist, interesting beers and a large selection of wines by the glass or carafe.

name: Belon
address: No.41 Elgin Street, SoHo
description: Belon is a neo-Parisian bistro showcasing French-rooted yet locally influenced cooking created with the best available ingredients in the form of well-executed basics made from scratch. Reminiscent of the dynamic food scene found in Paris's 11th arrondissement, Belon presents a refreshing genre of French cuisine in a pared-down SoHo space that allows the restaurant’s sincere approach to food to shine. Belon was awarded one star in the 2019 and 2020 Michelin Guide and jumped from 40 to 4 on Asia's 50 Best Restaurants List between its debut in 2018 to 2020.

name: Okra Kitchen
address: 110 Queen's Road West G/f
description: Okra kitchen is a very casual izakaya in the Sai Ying Pun neighborhood of Hong Kong specialising in flavorful charcoal grilled small plates and sashimi. We only serve natural sakes and wines because thats all we drink. All of our ingredients are natural and are produced exclusively for us or come from producers that we know and trust, because thats the way that we eat. We do not accept reservations and we only have bar seats in front of our open kitchen or standing tables. We are an extension of Okra 1949 in Beijing, China.

name: Capo
address: Shop 4C-D, Tower 1, PL/F., China Hong Kong City
description: Wanting to feel at home again, simple well made dishes prepared with passion, so here we are making hand made fresh pizza and pasta like long ago. Our Chef and Pizza-man are both Italian, passionate about their work, combining their artistry to make you feel as if you were in Italy. This is our philosophy, no fanfares, just original recipes and authentic Italian products.

name: The Sultan's Table
address: 3-5 Old Bailey Street, Soho LG/F, Hollywood Commercial House, Central
description: While it’s True that Hong Kong is a hotbed of Authentic International cuisines, the city seems to be lacking when it comes to Traditional Mediterranean cuisine. We’re changing that here at The Sultan’s Table. At our comfortable premises in Soho, we offer Fresh Mediterranean cuisine made with love by our passionate chefs. Our renewed menu is ranging from hearty dishes like the Adana Kebap to vegetarian options. Our sophisticated restaurant is ideal for any special occasion, whether it’s a romantic first date or a celebratory dinner or for merely chilling with shisha and drinks. With some of the friendliest service in Hong Kong, you’ll feel welcomed at The Sultan’s Table.

name: Le Pain Quotidien
address: Shop G40-41, The Avenue, Lee Tung Avenue, Wan Chai
description: Le Pain Quotidien, now an international brand with more than 240 restaurants in over 18 countries around the world, launched in Hong Kong early March 2016 in collaboration with major Hong Kong restaurant group, Dining Concepts. Founded in Brussels in 1990 by baker and chef, Alain Coumont, Le Pain Quotidien will bring its bakery-restaurant communal dining style to the enjoyment of Hong Kong's casual dining scene. Le Pain Quotidien, which means "the daily bread" in French, invites guests to escape their hectic urban lifestyles and savor the simplicity of good food and good company around the communal table. Le Pain Quotidien serves simple, wholesome and sustainable food for breakfast, brunch, lunch and dinner in most locations. Made with organic ingredients whenever possible, the menu includes soups, salads, signature tartines, pastries and artisanal bread. The menu also features many vegan and vegetarian options.

name: Dacha
address: 38-40 Hollywood Road G/Floor Wing On Building
description: Family - owned restaurant, with an authentic Eastern European Cuisine. MODERN VISION AND TIMELESS TRADITIONS Everyone of us has a favorite place where you can relax and unwind from the city’s buzz, and share with friends, family or co-workers a delicious variety of comfort food. In our memories, this place is dacha – a family’s own country house with a garden, where you can grow fruit and vegetables to enjoy home cooking. DACHA (鄉間別墅) Restaurant & Bar brings to life the inviting atmosphere of an authentic country house – dacha. You can leave all worries behind, enjoy a cozy atmosphere and clean your mind with regular trips to DACHA. Our menu offers meals for any taste and food is only a part of expirience. WELCOME TO DACHA! 歡迎來到 鄉間別墅

name: La Creperie
address: 1/F, Kui Chi Mansion, 100-102 Queen's Road East Wan Chai
description: Coming to La Crêperie is about enjoying our great specialties. But we are also always happy to introduce the Brittany region and its culture to the many travelers and dreamers visiting our place. This is why coming to La Crêperie is as if you were escaping for the time of your stay, enjoying our numerous very authentic galettes, crêpes, cakes, mussels and even oysters we import from Brittany in various countries. You will also have the chance to drink the best apple ciders in town, while listening to Brittany traditional music in a friendly atmosphere and nautical decor. After our success in Shanghai, La Crêperie has already brought its concept to Hong- Kong, Saigon, Phnom Penh and Taipei. Many more projects are planned which we hope will bring our customers a great experience. So if you are in one of these cities and you are willing to quit the busy and noisy life of the streets, look for the lighthouse, our logo, the symbol of Brittany that we borrowed to show the way to safety and comfort... Welcome on board,

description: Our restaurant provide high quality food and drinks. No matter in starter or to main course, we cook with high quality Ingredients. We recommend Lousiana Pizza / Baby Back Ribs and Spaghetti with natural angus beef meatballs. Food are nice and juicy! Also must try our nepalese Momo. We are different with others! Drinks we got our signature cocktails as our Award winning bartender able to wow customer.

name: Woo Cow Hotpot
address: 1-2/F, China Insurance Building, 48 Cameron Road, Tsim Sha Tsui
description: Experience traditional Chinese hot pot in Hong Kong Style. Woo Cow Hotpot was well known for its soups base and main ingredients. There are over 20 different soup bases and more than 180 different ingredients to choose from. The most picked ingredient must be our thinly sliced beef. We have different beef cuts from Loin, Lean Brisket and Ribs and more. Different parts bring you different taste and texture. Our innovative soup base can be categorized as beef basic, chicken basic, pork basic and seafood basic. These soups are eaten and drunk for their flavor and also for health benefits. Try our "Tom Yum Goong Soup" or "Sichuan Spicy Soup" if you are looking for something hot and spicy; while you can also try "Vegetarian Shark Fin with Chicken in white gourd” or "Pork Bones Pot" if you are looking for original taste. We offer private rooms with TV and pleasant seating for your enjoyment.

name: Kaum Hong Kong
address: Potato Head, G/F, 100 Third Street, Sai Ying Pun, Western District Hong Kong Isalnad
description: Potato Head Hong Kong is the debut space for our most recent restaurant concept, Kaum. Guests are invited to enjoy an in-depth experience of traditional Indonesian ingredients and cooking techniques. Hand-carved Toraja panels hang from the ceiling, the tableware is all custommade by ceramics producers in Bali and the walls are adorned with Indonesian art and textiles.

name: Picada
address: 2/F, LKF29, 29 Wyndham Street, Central
description: Journey Latin America through your palette at Picada, a Latin fusion restaurant and bar that celebrates the diversity of Latin culture. Overlooking the buzzing streets of Lan Kwai Fong, the colourful space and oasis terrace invites you in to escape the crowds and enjoy artfully crafted food, specialty drinks, live music and great company. The creative menu will take diners on a culinary expedition through Latin America with iconic flavours and dishes from each country - a veritable “picada” of Latin cuisine. Visit the lively team at Picada, the heart of Latin gastronomy and culture in Hong Kong, for lunch, dinner, drinks & dancing.

name: COBO HOUSE
address: G/F & 1/F, 8-12 South Lane, Sai Wan, Western District
description: COBO means Community of Bohemians, and COBO HOUSE is an establishment where edible art is served, and art pieces are showcased for guests to experience and appreciate, aiming to fuel the world with a Bohemian style of living. Upholding the spirit of an artisan, the establishment delivers a farm to table experience and proudly houses its very own mineral-rich Okinawa sea sand garden, from which the menu’s organic herbs and edible plants are grown.

address: G/F, No.17-23 Minden Avenue, Tsim Sha Tsui
description: BRICK LANE Gallery is an extension of BRICK LANE, and was among the first to pioneer the concept of crossing a gallery with a restaurant in Hong Kong. Art is an important part of BRICK LANE Gallery, they wish to help local artists create visibility and uncover opportunities, thus on a quarterly basis, they would collaborate with different art people or units to host exhibition in the restaurant. On the food front, its the same unparalled quality range of English meals they serve up at BRICK LANE, including best sellers All Day Breakfast, Eggs Benedict, Fish and Chips and freshly baked Red Velvet Cakes by their own bakery. It is truly a space that allows diners to respite in this buzzy and crowded metropolitan.

name: The Grill Room
address: 459-461 Lockhart Road, Causeway Bay 5/F, The L Square
description: Hong Kong’s reputation as a gourmet paradise is well deserved. The city has a venerable culinary history, enriched with flavours and influences from around the world. The Grill Room is proud to embrace this tradition, adding our own distinct style and philosophy to the mix and thus creating a new chapter in Hong Kong’s culinary greatness. From the starting point of the heritage and expertise of our chefs and service team, we have developed an overall experience that is warm, easy-going and friendly, designed to encourage sharing with family and friends in a joyful atmosphere. The elements that have forged this vision include a focus on the freshest ingredients from respected local and international suppliers, a dedication to craftsmanship, rustic flavours, modern-styled dishes and a carefully chosen drinks list. We invite you to kick back and relax, shake off the world outside, peruse the menu – please ask us for recommendations and advice– and, most of all, have a fabulous time as our guests!

name: SKYE
address: 27/F, The Park Lane Hong Kong, 310 Gloucester Road, Causeway Bay
description: Set against a backdrop of Hong Kong’s most breath-taking views of Victoria Harbour and Victoria Park, SKYE is a roofbar and restaurant located on the 27th floor of The Park Lane Hong Kong, a Pullman Hotel, offering an expansive French contemporary culinary experience curated by an international team in the 8,000 sq ft place. Helmed by Head Chef Lee Adams, SKYE will delight guests with a variety of contemporary French cuisine showcasing Chef Adams’ award-winning culinary techniques and stellar palate honed through his culinary career at the Michelin-starred establishments of Gary Rhodes and The Waterside Inn in the UK. Chef Adams’ menu will be complemented by bespoke-designed and sophisticated contemporary cocktails. Inspired by the eclectic and distinctive characteristics of Hong Kong, the menu boast an extraordinary collection of signature cocktails featuring artisanal and boutique spirits, seasonal ingredients, and visually stunning presentations. An impressive wine list from the old and new world is selected to be paired with the menu. Decor in SKYE is touched with grace and comfort, bringing the result of a sleek look that marries glitz and glamour with relaxing charm. Famous German street artist is commissioned to create a central piece of mixed medium textural art reminiscent of the wavy lines of seashells, adding an element of fun and modern chicness to the trend-setting space. In addition to the main restaurant space, SKYE consists of three private dining rooms providing a classic and serene backdrop for entertaining large and small groups alike. A large outdoor deck dominated with an illuminating oblong bar offers mesmerizing views of Victoria Harbour and Victoria Park. An in-house DJ will be performing every night, creating a hip and vibrant ambience.

name: Le Pain Quotidien
address: Shop 008, LG1/F, Pacific Place, 88 Queensway, Admiralty Unit 008, Level LG1, Pacific Place
description: We're a Belgian bakery and restaurant serving simple, wholesome and seasonal food. Le Pain Quotidien means "the daily bread" in French, and like our name suggests, we're bakers at heart. Although our handmade, organic bread is how we got our start, we serve a variety of healthy options like organic coffee, pastries, eggs, tartines, soups, salads and desserts. At Le Pain Quotidien, we believe that food should be simple, nourishing and delicious. That's why we source ingredients that are local or organic whenever possible. We also believe in the importance of eating a healthy, plant-based diet, so you'll find many vegetarian or vegan options on our menu.

description: Soul Food Hong Kong is a neighbourhood Thai restaurant inspired by the rich culinary traditions of Thailand and its distinctive regional cuisines. The menu pays homage to the vibrant local dishes of Bangkok’s famous, yet fast disappearing street stalls, family run shophouse restaurants and night markets. From North to South, Thailand’s favourite dishes are served in a lively yet homey space.

name: Ivan The Kozak
address: 1/F, Parekh House, 63 Wyndham Street, Central 1/F Parekh House
description: Ivan The Kozak has been serving the best Eastern European Cuisine in Hong Kong since 2001. This family-run restaurant serves authentic Russian and Ukrainian cuisine, complemented by an extensive selection of rare vodkas and wines imported directly from Eastern Europe.

name: Quarter Master
address: 1 Second Street, Sai Ying Pun
description: Honor The Beast - Redefining Our Food Culture Located in Sai Ying Pun, Quarter Master is a restaurant that only sources its meat from Bones & Blades, its next-door butchery, and serves quality steaks and burgers. All our meat is imported from family-owned farms where livestock is bred and raised in the pure wilderness. Cattle roam free and graze only on the nutrient-dense grasses, untainted by antibiotics, growth hormones, pesticides or pollutants. The result is a healthy beef with distinctive taste and with all the health and flavour benefits that come from being grass-fed animals. Quarter Master's philosophy is simply a matter of thinking beyond each ingredient and considering the environment from which it came. As well as inspiring a greater sense of social consciousness, the food we provide can extend the scope of creative possibilities in the kitchen – and ultimately enhance the quality of life.

name: DJAPA
address: Shop G18-20 & F18A, G/F, Lee Tung Avenue, 200 Queen_s Road East, Wan Chai
description: Located in the heart of Wan Chai, this colourful favela-inspired restaurant and bar fuses the intricacy and freshness of Japanese cuisine with the bold and hearty flavours of Brazil. Hong Kong’s first Nipo-Brasileiro restaurant and whisky bar is not just a place for drinking and dining, art lovers will appreciate the colourful artworks by renowned artists from around the world. These loud and quirky pieces enhance DJAPA’s relaxed favela style, echoing the casual style of graffiti. DJAPA’s ground floor is home to a relaxing bar and lounge with colourful seating and Japanese-style stools in industrial-chic surrounds. Floor-to-ceiling windows allow for people watching whilst sipping on Japanese and Brazilian inspired cocktails. DJAPA’s stellar bar houses over 300 types of exclusive Japanese whiskies, wines and a selection of fine Japanese sakes. On the first floor, the casual dining room is equally convivial and boasts an open kitchen that encourages diners to interact with the team of friendly, hospitable chefs. Above the chef’s counter, bamboo and PET bottles called PETLAMP hanging above to represent the chic and cultural mix of the South American and Asian culture.

Bringing a casual approach to Nikkei cuisine, TokyoLima serves up a menu that balances the heat of Peru with the delicate flavours of Japan. Dating back over 100 years, Nikkei cuisine originates from Peru’s large Japanese population and is best described as the melding of both cultures. Uma Nota is a modern boteco, or botequim, which in Brazil is traditionally known as a meeting place for bohemians looking for a delicious drink, mouth-watering street food and a fun, easy-going vibe. Uma Nota is unpretentious, open-minded, and lively, qualities which are reflected in its design, its food, its drinks and its atmosphere. Behind that is a journey to explore the essential joy at the heart of the ingredients of the French Mediterranean that we take as our inspiration. The sun-soaked artichokes, lemons, olives, courgettes, tomatoes, peppers and girolles, the freshest seafood, meat and pasta: they lead everything.

Located in the heart of Hong Kong and designed by award-winning designer Joyce Wang, ICHU recreates the convivial experience you find when dining in local Lima restaurants. Celebrating the contemporary Peruvian cuisine in a relaxed, bistro-style setting, the menu showcases authentic flavours while honouring local culinary traditions.

In True "Pica Pica" style, the food menu is rooted in tradition but features a modern take on classic Spanish dishes and cooking methods. Influenced by Chef Sanuy's culinary experiences throughout Europe and Asia, Pica Pica delivers a unique culinary approach to Hong Kong’s current dining scene with a produce-driven, small plate menu that’s inspired by regional Spanish cooking techniques. Each dish on the menu is meant to be enjoyed “family style” and sharing with dining companions is highly encouraged. description: Silencio is Hong Kong's only contemporary izakaya featuring live entertainment. The latest restaurant by award-winning hospitality group Le Comptoir, Silencio recreates the vibrant ambience of Japan's much-loved drinking dens, uplifted with an impressive line-up of live jazz, a menu of reimagined Japanese Izakaya favorites and sleek interiors. The kitchen is helmed by Sean Mell, previously The Executive Chef of NOBU from Four Seasons New York to Intercontinental Hong Kong. Using premium seasonal ingredients and modern techniques, Chef Mell introduces a refined rendition of traditional Japanese Izakaya favorites that respect tradition but are not bound by it, paired with curated selection of junmai sakes and hand-crafted cocktails. Silencio's inventive sushi and sashimi menu will showcase the freshest selection of fish flown from all corners of the world. Silencio's interiors showcase the artworks of Tokyo-born cult figure Tomoo Gokita.

With over 20 years of culinary experience and renowned gourmet roots, Chef Elzer is highly regarded as one of the leading French chefs in Hong Kong. With his passion and talent for food perfection, Chef Elzer is constantly refining and redefining taste, textures and techniques of French gastronomy. The design of L’Envol is inspired by the inimitable savoir faire of French craftsmanship and haute couture. L’Envol is a contemporary French salon that fuses art, couture and fine cuisine, with a shot of French art de vivre. The sophisticated dining room perfectly encapsulates Parisian flair in an opulent and feminine palette of beige, white and gold with pastel marble and brushed bronze.

Rùn features a stunning modern setting inspired by the architecture of a traditional Chinese tea pavilion with two private dining rooms available for intimate celebrations or occasions. Lighting at Rùn is a contemporary take on the classic Chinese lanterns in molded glass cubes and bronze, creating a soft, atmospheric glow.

description: Located in the iconic two-story space at 35 Bridges Street, Taqueria Super Macho is an unfussy, après-surf taco bar. Don your party hat but don’t bother shaking the sand off your sandals, expect a simple, pared-down aesthetic inspired by the roadside taquerias that litter the streets of Puerto Vallarta and Cabo San Lucas, essentially sheds converted into whimsical little eateries. Communal tables, each with a centre piece of Valentina hot sauce and paper napkins, invite you to kick-back with a fruity libation and relax with other sun-kissed comrades.

description: Ever travelled to Persia, or heard someone travel there? One thing for sure to remember from this land, is the famous Persian cuisine and its unique taste. Its uniqueness is due to its location. Historical culinary interactions with Mediterranean cuisines from the West and those from the East have made Persian food both more colorful and tastier. Internationally known for its culinary diversity and its great number of cuisines, Hong Kong never had a Persian restaurant until very recently. LOVEAT, the First Ever Persian Restaurant in Hong Kong opened its doors to food lovers eager to discover the unexplored. It offers genuine and authentic Persian food; the ambiance has the charm of Persian culture; and it’s conveniently located at the heart of SOHO.

We use fresh lemon, garlic, ginger, herbs & spices to create our peri peri goodness within each chicken. Paired with our house made peri peri sauce, the chicken is succulent and juicy with a nice tangy flavour that is perfect with our fresh salads and chicken salt fries. In collaboration with Hong Kong’s finest craft breweries Hk Lovecraft and Heroes we have a selection of craft beers that are great with grilled chicken and our munchies. All sanitizing and cleaning procedures are reinforced at all levels by increasing the frequency so as to ensure optimal hygiene and sanitation levels. We continue to monitor the situation closely and do more if necessary. We make every endeavor to make your experience a better one.Stay healthy and strong and Eat Well! Food is our passion and it is our aim to establish the benchmark in Southeast Asia and beyond for a contemporary, specialised steakhouse concept. We are proud to serve you the finest steakhouse-style food, using only the best available meat products sourced from selected farms in Victoria, New South Wales and the United States.
